sentences.english: The left slice shows an area active during extemporaneous speech just posterior and adjacent to the tumor.
sentences.chinese: 左切片显示面积活跃在即席讲话只是后，毗邻的肿瘤。

sentences.english: Mistakes live in the neighbourhood of truth and therefore delude us.
sentences.chinese: 错误与真理毗邻而居，所以会迷惑我们。

sentences.english: Located in the west of the planned area, adjacent to the tourism zone and the downtown area.
sentences.chinese: 位于规划区西部，毗邻旅游经济区和中心行政区。

sentences.english: Meadow planting. New island beds directly adjacent to the water, were designed into the new patio.
sentences.chinese: 直接与水体毗邻的草坪种植岛被设计成新的露台。

sentences.english: Viet Nam is contiguous to China.
Japan abuts China, and the two countries have a consanguineous relationship in economy.
sentences.chinese: 日本与中国毗邻，且两国之间经济联系密切。

sentences.english: This house finds its place in a big forest of pines, near the beach.
sentences.chinese: 希贝尔塔别墅毗邻海滩，隐于茂密的大松林间。

sentences.english: Myanmar has a total of 13 main border trade points with its four neighboring countries.
sentences.chinese: 缅甸与其毗邻四国共有13个主要贸易口岸。

sentences.english: Split the surface with the adjacent curves.
sentences.chinese: 斯普利特的表面与毗邻的曲线。

sentences.english: The contiguity of the house and the garage was a convenience in bad weather.
sentences.chinese: 住宅和车库毗邻，这在天气不好的时候是很方便的。

sentences.english: A bibliography of the Tibetan highland and its adjacent districts.
sentences.chinese: 青康藏高原暨毗邻地区西文文献目录。

sentences.english: The complex ends in a court adjoining the radial workshop.
sentences.chinese: 综合体尽端是一个庭院，与放射性布局的研讨室毗邻。

sentences.english: Since ancient times, Tibetan and Chinese peoples have lived as neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 中文版是“藏汉两个民族自古以来毗邻而居。”

sentences.english: Objective To investigate the anatomic relations of the thoracic pedicles to the spinal nerve roots.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨胸椎弓根与毗邻的神经的解剖关系。

sentences.english: Situated right next to the Inner Ring, SNIEC offers you an easy access to the city centre.
sentences.chinese: 毗邻内环线，使您来往中心城区更为便捷。

definition: to be right next to/close neighbor
to be located at/to be situated in
to be located at/to be situated at/to lie
to be situated/to be located (of a building)
to be right next to/to lean closely against
to be situated/located at (of building)/also written 坐落[zuo4 luo4]
